issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.raw:
Looks similar to an issue I had, i guess ERROR is defined somewhere upstream as a preprocessor macro and gets expanded here, leading to an error.
You can try setting an 
"#undef ERROR "
somewhere before the typedef.
A real solution would be to check where the ERROR macro definition comes from and to change it there, or to change the name ERROR in the protobuffer msg definition. There could be side effects however, so "hacking" the generated .hh would be the first thing to try.
content.html: Looks similar to an issue I had, i guess ERROR is defined somewhere upstream as a preprocessor macro and gets expanded here, leading to an error. You can try setting an "#undef ERROR " somewhere before the typedef. A real solution would be to check where the ERROR macro definition comes from and to change it there, or to change the name ERROR in the protobuffer msg definition. There could be side effects however, so "hacking" the generated .hh would be the first thing to try.
